intro: Corothamnus acutangulus, commonly known as the narrowleaf thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight pubescence, while its stems are erect and branched. Corothamnus acutangulus is known for its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
